Posts.Content: Good morning Jim... That little devil has been sitting in the back of my mind for a couple weeks whispering what if the 6 is really a 7..sigh?? I've suggested and printed all the paperwork necessary to send to JH for a second opinion. He is suppose to discuss that with doc today too. Gotta love the Little League... I live right across the river from the complex in Williamsport. Thanks for chiming in and good point on the surgery after 70..sigh.. so much to think about! Originally Posted by Jim215 Welcome Joy -- and fellow PA resident -- Go Little League World Series: I, too, agree that your husband's G6 stats lean strongly toward a path of active surveillance. However, playing Devil's Advocate as I often do (not to be confused with my respected forum brother ASAdvocate), I would like to mention two caveats: First, the initial Gleason score may not tell the whole story if there are higher-Gleason score critters still hiding in his prostate; Second, and this is a big one, many doctors prefer to not perform surgery on prostate cancer patients after roughly age 70 and depending upon the overall health of the patient. Since your husband is nearing that age group, I mention this because if he is going to fire the surgery bullet, the window of opportunity may be closing. Best of luck to you both, Jim
Posts.Title: Newbie... Tomorrow my love meets with urologist for treatment options

Posts.Content: UPDATE..... Doctor (urologist) spent about half an hour with my love. He asked first if he had any questions and said they would start with those. My man pulled out the questions I had prepared for him and the doctor started completing it for him. When he got most of the way down the first page he commented on how much he liked what I did and asked if he had another copy with him that they could keep on hand. He did (I sent him well prepared lol). As for the discussion... Doctor said I have to offer you surgery and radiation but my best suggestion is Active Surveillance (answered prayer). He commented that it was unlikely for the cancer to spread. Where I asked about the genetic testing he wrote (I think.. doing the best I can with his writing) PTEN/ERG Promack -- very low risk catagory. He is a stage T1c... core was 12% cancerous. Prostate is 60 gms (not sure what it is suppose to be as I was thinking before he said 60 cc). He noted his last PSA was 5.5 (which must have been off bloodwork we don't have a copy of). My guy goes in July for bloodwork and then to his GP in August. October 26th he goes back to Uro and is to get PSA a week before. Thank you for all for your information and for calming my nerves as I waited for the news.
Posts.Signature: I'm here for my love... he is 69 (closer to 70)...PSA was 4.5 April 2016 and 4.85 October 2016 ( I don't have entire history but know the highest it ever read was 4.93)... was told at last appt when C bomb was dropped there was cancer in 1 of 12 cores and on a scale of 1-10 it was a 6 (we now know 6 isn't an awful thing thanks to the internet). He was also informed at time of biopsy that his prostate was enlarged (he thinks they said 60 cc) and contained stones.

Newbie... Tomorrow my love meets with urologist for treatment options

Posts.Content: Hey Chuck... it worked this time. Thanks for your help Tomorrow is the day my love meets with his urologist to discuss treatment options (which I feel we already pretty much know). I'm sending him with his pages of questions including asking for Prolaris test and paperwork for John Hopkins second opinion. He has finally agreed to ask his brother to sit in with him and doctor and he is taking a mini recorder with him hoping he can record it. Prayers please for clarity and for calmness for me while I wait to hear from him. His appointment is 10:45. I'm praying for AS but not too sure doc will support it. He is 69 (closer to 70)...PSA was 4.5 April 2016 and 4.85 October 2016... was told at last appt when C bomb was dropped there was cancer in 1 of 12 cores and on a scale of 1-10 it was a 6 (we now know 6 isn't an awful thing thanks to the internet).
